channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: What Putin’s nuclear-capable Oreshnik missile means for NATO security
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The Russian leader’s use of the missile against Ukraine sends a powerful signal about his intention to weaken NATO and bend Europe’s security architecture to Russia’s will.

item.title: Canada’s Trudeau meets with Trump at Mar-a-Lago after tariff threat
item.dc:creator: David J. Lynch, Maegan Vazquez, Hannah Knowles
item.description: The sudden visit to Florida by the Canadian leader came days after Trump threatened to impose a 25 percent tariff on Canadian and Mexican goods.

item.title: Israel-Hezbollah cease-fire appears to hold amid violation accusations
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Vivian Ho, Alon Rom, Mohamad El Chamaa, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The Lebanese army said Israel violated the cease-fire agreement, while the IDF said it was responding to violations by Hezbollah.

item.title: Syrian rebels breach Aleppo, Syria’s largest city, in startling advance
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: The lightning assault on Aleppo by the Islamist militant group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham abruptly redrew the front lines of Syria’s civil war.

item.title: Hezbollah chief claims victory in first remarks since cease-fire
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: At least 75 dead in northern Gaza attacks, officials say
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Hazem Balousha, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Restored Notre Dame unveiled with grand tour led by Macron
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis
item.description: The televised tour is the first look inside the revamped cathedral since the 2019 fire that put it at risk of collapse.

item.title: U.K. backs assisted-dying law after emotional debate over end-of-life care
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: The bill, modeled after Oregon’s law, would apply to terminally ill patients and could usher in one of the most dramatic social changes Britain has seen in years.

item.title: Mexico shuts watchdog agencies, intensifying fears for its democracy
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Valentina Muñoz Castillo
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum says the agencies were unnecessary. Critics call their dissolution a power grab by the ruling party.

item.title: Could you feed yourself on $70 a month? Chinese millennials are trying.
item.dc:creator: Lyric Li
item.description: The cost of living is weighing on consumers everywhere. But some Chinese, worried about making ends meet in a slowing economy, are taking this food-spending challenge.

item.title: After Lebanon cease-fire, Israeli families hope for hostage deal
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin

item.title: Chinese journalist and former Harvard fellow sentenced to 7 years
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Christian Shepherd
item.description: Dong Yuyu’s conviction on espionage charges shows how the space for independent thought and open discussion in China has narrowed since Xi Jinping took power in 2012.

item.title: Can you stop a teen from using TikTok? Australia is about to find out.
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Australia passed a law banning children under 16 from using social media apps like TikTok and Snapchat. Whether it can be enforced remains in question.

item.title: Mexico’s president has ‘excellent’ talk with Trump, dismisses tariff threat
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Niha Masih
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum spoke to President-elect Donald Trump after he threatened to impose tariffs and she hinted at retaliation in a letter.

item.title: Russia rains missiles on Ukraine after Trump names new envoy to conflict
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: There was a cautious note of optimism among some Ukrainians for retired Gen. Keith Kellogg’s past supportive remarks for Ukraine to defend itself.

item.title: After Lebanon cease-fire, Israeli families hope for hostage deal
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: Hostage families are pushing the Biden administration and the Trump transition team to help secure the release of their loved ones.

item.title: Rare footprints suggest two of our prehistoric ancestors may have met
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: The footprints are the first clear evidence that the two hominin species shared a habitat, raising questions about whether their interactions shaped human evolution.

item.title: Israeli strikes test cease-fire; IDF warns displaced Lebanese not to return
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Adela Suliman, Frances Vinall
item.description: Israeli tank and artillery fire struck several villages, Lebanon’s state media reported, as the Israeli military warned civilians not to return to the area.

item.title: Missing hiker found alive after 50 days in Canadian wilderness
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: Sam Benastick, 20, went missing after going on a solo camping trip in a remote park in the Rocky Mountains. Police suspended the search operation in late October.

item.title: The Russian guide to Trump’s Cabinet picks
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Who’s good for Russia and who’s going to be a problem among Trump’s Cabinet choices, according to Russian commentators.

item.title: U.S. moving to approve $680 million arms sale to Israel, sources say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, John Hudson, Adam Taylor

item.title: In Beirut suburb, streets come back to life but the future is uncertain
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: China announces top military official is under investigation
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Katrina Northrop
item.description: The suspension of Miao Hua, one of China's highest-ranking military officials, marks an escalation in leader Xi Jinping's campaign to tackle corruption.
